title: 113_hr697
content:
The Act is titled the "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" and defines terms such as Federal land, hazardous substance, pollutant or contaminant, remedy, and Henderson redevelopment agency. The Federal land refers to specific Bureau of Reclamation and Bureau of Land Management land within the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency, authorized by Nevada law, designates a private entity to handle the remediation and redevelopment of the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The site consists of approximately 1,262 acres of land, including Federal and non-Federal land. The map titled "Three Kids Mine Project Area" outlines the site. The Project Site encompasses 1,262 acres of Federal and adjacent non-Federal land depicted as the "Three Kids Mine Project Site" on the map. The Secretary will convey all US interests in the Federal land to the Henderson Redevelopment Agency upon meeting specified conditions, including payment of fair market value. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must pay the fair market value for the Federal land as determined by an appraisal conducted according to nationally recognized standards. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must pay fair market value for Federal land based on nationally recognized appraisal standards, excluding historical mining contamination. The Secretary will estimate costs for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The Phase II environmental site assessment for the Three Kids Mine Project Site must be based on a comprehensive report approved by the State and prepared according to ASTM International Standard E-2137-06. The Phase II environmental site assessment must adhere to ASTM International Standards E-1527-05 and E-1903-11. The Secretary will review cost information provided by the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, the Responsible Party, and the State for estimating costs. If there is a disagreement, they will jointly select experts to assist in making the final cost estimate. The Secretary will begin the appraisal and cost estimates within 30 days of enacting the Act. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency or Responsible Party will reimburse appraisal costs. The fair market value of Federal land will be adjusted based on estimated remediation and reclamation costs. The conveyance of land is contingent on the execution of a mine remediation and reclamation agreement. The conveyance of Federal land is contingent on the execution of a mine remediation and reclamation agreement between the State and the Responsible Party. The agreement must obligate the Responsible Party to perform necessary remediation and reclamation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The consent order or agreement administered by the State obligates the Responsible Party to perform remediation and reclamation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site to protect human health and the environment. It includes financial assurance provisions and requires notification from the Henderson Redevelopment Agency within 90 days of the agreement's execution. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must notify the Secretary within 90 days of the mine remediation agreement's execution to accept conveyance of Federal land. The Federal land is withdrawn from various activities for a 10-year period, subject to valid existing rights. The Act relinquishes withdrawals under public land laws for Federal land no longer needed by the Bureau of Reclamation, allowing immediate conveyance. Existing rights holders can continue using water conveyance infrastructure on Federal land permitted before the Act's effective date. The Act allows for the immediate conveyance of Federal land no longer needed by the Bureau of Reclamation, preserving existing rights holders' use of water conveyance infrastructure. The boundary of the River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern is adjusted to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. Responsibilities for mine remediation and reclamation agreements fall on the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada after conveyance. Responsibility for complying with mine remediation and reclamation agreements falls on the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada. The Act does not affect the Secretary's responsibility to take additional actions to protect public health and the environment. The Southern Nevada Public Land Management Act of 1998 does not apply to land conveyed under this Act. The curr_chunk can be summarized as:
